definition: to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture

sentences.english: What is your reflection upon Samuel's retirement speech?
sentences.chinese: 你對撒母耳的退休演講有何感想？

sentences.english: She will give a touching valediction at graduation.
sentences.chinese: 她將在畢業典禮作感人的告別演講。

sentences.english: John's about to start a nine-week national speaking tour.
sentences.chinese: 約翰即將展開一場歷時九周的全國巡迴演講。

sentences.english: His speech kindled the crowd with passion.
sentences.chinese: 他的演講使羣衆充滿激情。

sentences.english: Geithner noted similar concerns in his speech this week.
sentences.chinese: 蓋特納在這周的演講中表達了同樣的擔心。

sentences.english: He finished his speech with the same slogan.
sentences.chinese: 他以同樣的口號結束了他的演講。
演講者講得聲音都嘶啞了。

sentences.english: Most of the audience left before a speaker finishing his speech in a meeting room.
sentences.chinese: 一位演講者還未講完，大多數聽衆就已離開大會議室。

sentences.english: It is the last occasion on which we shall ever hear Krishnamurti discoursing to himself.
sentences.chinese: 我們將最後一次聽到克氏對自己的演講。

sentences.english: We have an English Speaking Competition, singing and dancing competition at the party.
sentences.chinese: 晚會上，我們舉行英語演講比賽和歌舞比賽。

sentences.english: When the panels started, I took a lonely seat in the back.
sentences.chinese: 當演講開始時，我獨自在後面找了個座位坐下。

sentences.english: Al gave his best 2 a.m. version of the stump speech.
sentences.chinese: 艾爾發表了他最精彩的一次下午2點的政治演講。

sentences.english: This is like the grand final of a concert that will bring your speech to a climax.
sentences.chinese: 它就像音樂會的終曲一樣將把你的演講推向高潮。

sentences.english: Design your presentation with the "less is more" philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 用“少即是多”原則設計你的演講。

sentences.english: Good speakers are usually good storytellers.
sentences.chinese: 好的演講者都愛講故事。

sentences.english: This series of lectures forms part of a complete course on French history.
sentences.chinese: 這一系列的演講爲一門法國史課程的一部分。

definition: to interview/to gather news/to hunt for and collect/to cover
to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
